description: The Williamsburg Bridge is a suspension bridge across the East River, connecting the Lower East Side with Williamsburg, Brooklyn.
The George Washington Bridge is a double-decked suspension bridge spanning the Hudson River, connecting Fort Lee, NJ with the Washington Heights.
The Queensboro Bridge is a cantilever bridge over the East River. It connects the Long Island City, Queens with with East Midtown, passing over Roosevelt Island
The Manhattan Bridge is a suspension bridge that crosses the East River, connecting Lower Manhattan with Downtown Brooklyn.
The Verrazzano Bridge is a suspension bridge connecting Staten Island and Brooklyn.
The Brooklyn Bridge is a hybrid cable-stayed/suspension bridge spanning the East River between Manhattan and Brooklyn.
The Seagram Building is a skyscraper at 375 Park Avenue, between 52nd and 53rd Streets, in the Midtown designed by Ludwig Mies van der Rohe.
detail: Seagram Building Marks Apex Of Mies van der Rohe's Career

description: The MetLife Building (formerly the Pan Am Building) is a skyscraper at Park Avenue and 45th Street, north of Grand Central Terminal.
detail: '200 Park Avenue' Preferred As Airline Heads South.

description: The Guggenheim is an art museum at 1071 Fifth Avenue between 88th and 89th Streets on the Upper East Side.
detail: The Guggenheim: Has a building ever inspired strong emotion in you?
